title: Data Flow Mapping

description.short: Understand where data comes from, what happens to it, and where it goes
description.medium: Map how data flows through your system to understand entry points, transformations, storage locations, and exit points - essential for security, compliance, and debugging
description.full: Data flow mapping visualizes the journey of data through your application - from user input to database to third-party services to backups. This understanding is critical for security (identifying attack surfaces), compliance (GDPR deletion requests, HIPAA audits), debugging (tracing data bugs), and architecture decisions. Learn to map trust boundaries, identify sensitive data flows, and create documentation that serves both technical and compliance needs.

why_it_matters: You can't secure what you can't see
GDPR and other regulations require knowing where data lives
Data bugs are often transformation bugs
Security breaches often exploit unmapped data flows

objectives: Understand why data flow mapping matters
Implement data lineage and audit trails

common_mistakes: Not updating maps when flows change
when_to_deprioritize: Internal tools with no sensitive data
